executable.title: Convert ITK image(s) into DICOM Segmentation Image
executable.description: Convert the volumetric segmentation(s) stored as labeled pixels using any of the formats supported by ITK, such as NRRD or NIFTI, into a DICOM Segmentation Object (further referred to as SEG).
executable.acknowledgements: This work is supported in part the National Institutes of Health, National Cancer Institute, Informatics Technology for Cancer Research (ITCR) program, grant Quantitative Image Informatics for Cancer Research (QIICR) (U24 CA180918, PIs Kikinis and Fedorov).

file.name: metaDataFileName
file.label: JSON metadata file
file.description: JSON file containing the meta-information that describes the measurements to be encoded. See documentation for details.

file.name: outputSEGFileName
file.label: SEG file name
file.description: File name of the DICOM SEG object that will store the result of conversion.

string-vector.name: dicomImageFiles
string-vector.label: DICOM images file names
string-vector.description: Comma-separated list of DICOM images that correspond to the original image that was segmented. This means you must have access to the original data in DICOM in order to use the converter (at least for now).

directory.name: dicomDirectory
directory.label: DICOM images directory
directory.description: Directory with the DICOM files corresponding to the original image that was segmented.

string-vector.name: segImageFiles
string-vector.label: Segmentation file names
string-vector.description: Comma-separated list of file names of the segmentation images in a format readable by ITK (NRRD, NIfTI, MHD, etc.). Each of the individual files can contain one or more labels (segments). Segments from different files are allowed to overlap. See documentation for details.

boolean.name: skipEmptySlices
boolean.label: Skip empty slices
boolean.description: Skip empty slices while encoding segmentation image. By default, empty slices will not be encoded, resulting in a smaller output file size.

boolean.name: verbose
boolean.label: Verbose
boolean.description: Display more verbose output, useful for troubleshooting.
